ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.modules.errorControl

Class BaseErrorControllerModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.property.PropertyUser
      • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.solver.SolverModule
        • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.modules.errorControl.BaseErrorControllerModule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmbErrControllerModule, SdErrControllerModule

    public abstract class BaseErrorControllerModule
extends SolverModule
    This abstract class implements the basic methods needed for typical stepsize controllers to estimate the next stepsize based on an error estimate.

    Ernst Hairer, Syvert Norsett, and Gerhard Wanner. "Solving Order Differential Equations I, 2nd Edition", pg.167.

    Josef Stoer and Roland Bulirsch. "Introduction to Numerical analysis", pg.448-454.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_A_MAX_NORMAL
      The default maximum increase in stepsize.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_A_MAX_REJECTED
      The default maximum increase in stepsize if the last step was rejected.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_A_MIN
      The default maximum decrease in stepsize.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_ALPHA
      The default alpha, a factor used for predictive and PI error control.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_ATOL
      The default absolute tolerance.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_BETA
      The default beta, a factor used for predictive and PI error control.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_RTOL
      The default relative tolerance.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_SAFETY
      The default size of the next step as compared to the calculated size of the next step.
      static org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 DEFAULT_THRESHOLD
      The default acceptance factor, generally used for error control via step-doubling error estimation.

      • get_tolerances

        protected org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector get_tolerances(org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector y1,
                                                            org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector y2)
        Calculate the specific tolerance values for a particular timestep. Based on the relative tolerances, absolute tolerances, and two solution vectors that are typically from the beginning and end of the timestep.
        Parameters:
        y1 - The first solution vector.
        y2 - The second solution vector.
        Returns:
        A vector of the tolerances for the particular timestep.
